meanings.definition: To make a conical hole in (a material) to allow the head of a screw or bolt to lie flush with or below the surface.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter was countersinking the screws into the wood to ensure a smooth finish.
meanings.sent2: Remember to countersink the screws properly to avoid any protrusions.
meanings.sent3: The handyman joked that he was a master at countersinking screws, making them disappear like magic.
meanings.sent4: Her precision in countersinking the bolts was like an artist sculpting the perfect shape.
meanings.sent5: The process of countersinking can be tricky, but practice makes perfect.

meanings.definition: A conical hole made in a material to allow the head of a screw or bolt to lie flush with or below the surface.
meanings.sent1: The countersinking on the metal sheet was done neatly, leaving no visible screw heads.
meanings.sent2: Make sure the countersinking is deep enough for the screw head to sit flush.
meanings.sent3: The countersinking on the table was so well-done that it looked like a pattern.
meanings.sent4: The countersinking on the sculpture gave it a seamless appearance, as if the bolts were never there.
meanings.sent5: The countersinking process requires precision to achieve a professional look.
